title: Thug bit chunk out of stranger’s neck and spat lump of flesh onto the street
text:
Jamie Furnell has been given an extended prison sentence of nearly 11 years (Picture: Carl Leslie)

A man has been described as a ‘wild animal’ after he was caught on camera attacking a man outside a Chinese restaurant.

Jamie Furnell, 28, bit a chunk out of a stranger’s neck and spat it out on the street before going to his ex’s home in Grimsby, Lincolnshire, where he bit his ex nine times.

He has now been jailed for nearly 11 years for the attacks as judge John Thackray described him as being a danger to the public.

His first victim was targeted after she refused to give him a bottle of coke she had just bought from a corner shop.

He followed her to China House where she was meeting her partner.

Furnell approached her and said ‘Oh, there you are’ before headbutting her, breaking her nose, and then doing the same to her boyfriend.

He took a chunk out of a man’s neck and then spat it out in the street (Picture: Carl Leslie)

There was a fight in the restaurant before they went outside and started fighting again.

As he got on top of the man he was seen jerking his head as he tore into his neck then spitting out the flesh which doctors could not reattach.

Prosecutor Jeremy Evans said: ‘Every time he looks in the mirror he is reminded of the attack.’

Nearly an hour later he turned up at his ex’s house while their six-month-old son was asleep upstairs.

Furnell kicked down the door while she was on the phone to 999 operators and she could be heard screaming while he bit her to the face and arms.

He was described as behaving like a wild animal during the attack (Picture: Humberside Police)

He also injured a police officer while she was arresting him.

Judge Thackray said the violence was ‘a drunken rampage’. He said: ‘You will use and brandish weapons and if they are not to hand you use your teeth.’

Detective Sergeant Tom Kelly of Humberside Police said: ‘The woman victim was head-butted in the assault and says the assault has changed her. She was confident, bubbly and outgoing before this horrendous attack.

‘It is awful now that this man has taken her confidence away and she has said the memories of that night will stay with her for the rest of her life.’
